title: National Gymnasts Caught in Sports Ministry Power Play
byline: Suspension of Olympian and National coach to protect powerful insider stuns gymnastic fraternity

title: Sri Lanka could top 2.7million tourist arrivals with promotion: Janaka Rathnayaka
byline: Sri Lanka has the potential to exceed 2.7 million tourist arrivals this year if the country is strategically promoted and positioned as a global travel destination, former Public Utilities Commission of Sri Lanka (PUCSL) Chairman Janaka Rathnayaka said.

title: Several medical professionals threaten TU action
byline: All supplementary medical professionals attached to 31 hospitals under the Western Province have decided to launch trade union action from Tuesday (19).

title: Minister urges calm ahead of hartal in North, East
byline: Cabinet Media Spokesman, Minister Dr. Nalinda Jayatissa appealed to the people of the Northern and Eastern Provinces not to be misled by what he described as distortions and false propaganda aimed at the government and the security forces.

title: 3 dead, 8 wounded in Brooklyn lounge shooting
byline: Three people are dead, 8 others wounded after a shooting at the Taste of the City lounge in Crown Heights, Brooklyn early Sunday.

title: Pakistan name squad for upcoming Asia Cup
byline: Salman Ali Agha will lead Pakistan for the upcoming UAE tri-series and the subsequent Asia Cup also to be played in the UAE.

title: At least 150 still missing in Pakistan after deadly flash floods
byline: More than 150 people are missing in northwest Pakistan, the head of the provincial disaster authority said Sunday, after flash floods that have killed at least 344 people in the country.

title: Passengers complain of long queues at BIA
byline: Passengers at the Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA) raised complaints last night over severe congestion, with long queues reported at both check-in counters and immigration.

title: Plastic debris from sunken MSC Elsa 3 continues to wash ashore in Sri Lanka
byline: The Marine Environment Protection Authority (MEPA) said that plastic debris from the MSC Elsa 3, which sank off the coast of India, continues to wash up along Sri Lankaâ€™s coastline.

title: Sri Lankan, two Malaysians nabbed in heroin bust
byline: Police arrested three men, including a Sri Lankan national, and successfully dismantled a heroin processing laboratory, operated by a drug distribution syndicate, in two raids in the Bukit Tambun area here on Tuesday.

title: Canada orders striking Air Canada flight attendants back to work
byline: More than 10,000 Air Canada flight attendants who went on strike early Saturday will be ordered to return to work by the Canada Industrial Relations Board (CIRB), said Jobs Minister Patty Hajdu.

title: 257 drownings reported so far this year: Police
byline: Police said that 257 people have died in drowning-related incidents across the country so far this year.
